My Personal Concerns with Orthodoxy

Infallible, Conscience Binding, and Inerrant

The formally held canonical positions of the EO Church are legitimately binding on the conscience of those who join the Church (though they may not be expressly taught in local congregations).

Why? Because they hold church tradition and scripture as equally infallible, inerrant, and binding. (see here)

Not Orthodox? Not Saved

The EO church formally holds that you are not saved if you are not Orthodox. Specifically, you cannot be saved if you:

  • Aren’t part of the orthodox church (add link)
  • Use leavened bread in communion (add link)
  • Use the wrong feast calendar (add link)
  • More on Anathemas (add link)

Faith = Right Information, not Trust

The EO church formally holds that you are saved by the right information about Jesus plus obedience to divine commandments. (see here)

Not Christ's Righteousness

The EO church formally holds that Christ’s righteousness does not justify you before God. It is your works that justify you, with Christ, because they merit what you deserve (either good or bad). (see here)

Icon Veneration is Clearly an Accretion

The formally held canonical positions of the EO Church are legitimately binding on the conscience of those who join the Church (though they may not be expressly taught in local congregations).
